page.title: 01Physical Features
page.content: The area is a rural one with farmland, farmhouses, and two villages.The low hills, small patches of woodland, winding lanes and footpaths make it scenically attractive. The {Caul bourne}-the small stream passing from South to North once had 5 working mills within 3 kilometres.The upper two-a fulling mill and a flour mill were South of our area. The paper mill at Nomans corner, Newbridge has disappeared, Lower Calbourne Mill is still working, Shalfleet Mill,situated where the Caul bourne joins the inlet of the Newtown estuary is now a private house. There are two villages {Newbridge} and {Shalfleet.}Newbridge is a quiet backwater.Shalfleet on the main Newport Yarmouth road is more well known.
